title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Rosalind Brewer is set to become the only black woman to run a Fortune 500 company. Which one?

A. Walgreens Boots Alliance

B. CVS Health

C. Rite Aid

D. AmerisourceBergen

---

2. In Hong Kong, WhatsApp users worried about privacy are trying a blast from the past. What is it?

A. ICQ

B. Walkie talkies

C. Carrier pigeons

D. Usenet

---

3. Ripple's future hinges on how a judge rules in a lawsuit by the SEC. What does Ripple do?

A. Makes a fortified wine that's in vogue again

B. Offers beauty products via multilevel marketing

C. Sells a cryptocurrency called XRP

D. Harvests energy from freshwater lakes

---

4. What habit, long in decline, has been bolstered by the pandemic?

A. Child-bearing

B. Sex

C. Smoking

D. Keeping a diary

---

5. The defection of another North Korean diplomat came to light. To which country had he been acting ambassador?

A. Kazakhstan

B. Kenya

C. Kiribati

D. Kuwait

---

6. A key regulator said that EU banks may be ignoring a big potential problem. What is it?

A. A global money-printing binge

B. Inadequate pandemic-related loss reserves

C. Historically low fertility rates

D. Soaring sovereign indebtedness

---

7. What technology are insurers using to generate near-instant repair estimates after auto accidents?

A. A new generation of satellite-based cameras

B. Sensors embedded throughout new cars

C. Artificial intelligence

D. Monte Carlo simulations

---

8. Thanks to a social media frenzy, shares in GameStop soared. Which popular Reddit forum has been buzzing about this?

A. WallStreetBets

B. ScrewTheShorts

C. GetRichQuik

D. GimmeGME

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. A

3. C

4. C

5. D

6. B

7. C

8. A
